title: Restore click interactivity by removing pointer-event blocking overlays

requirements.summary: Identify and fix any global overlay/stacking-context/CSS pointer-event rules preventing clicks from reaching interactive elements site-wide.
acceptanceCriteria: On the published site, clicking the HERO CTA buttons triggers their intended actions (scroll to #portfolio and scroll to #contact).
In PORTFOLIO, clicking a project card opens the project modal; clicking the backdrop or the close button closes it.
In CONTACT, input fields can be focused and typed into; the WhatsApp Direct button and social links are clickable.
No full-screen decorative layer (background gradients, starfield canvas, hero background images/grids, scanline effects, etc.) blocks pointer events over the main content.

file_operations.description: Audit the top-level layout stacking contexts and ensure the main content layer reliably sits above decorative layers (e.g., enforce a clear z-index strategy and avoid any accidental full-screen overlay covering <main>). Also wire in the dev-only click debug aid (REQ-19) behind a development-only gate.

Ensure all full-screen background layers (gradient div, starfield canvas, and grid image layer) cannot capture pointer events; verify their z-index keeps them behind content while remaining visually unchanged.

Ensure the hero's absolute/fixed decorative background layers (the image/grid parallax container) do not intercept clicks intended for CTA buttons; confirm content remains above decorative layers and buttons continue to scroll to #portfolio and #contact.
Verify project card click handling is not blocked by any overlaying decorative layers; ensure clicking a card still sets the selected project and opens the modal reliably.
Verify form inputs and links are not blocked by overlays; ensure inputs can be focused/typed into and external links/buttons are clickable after overlay pointer-event fixes.

requirements.summary: Make all purely decorative full-screen/absolute/fixed visual layers ignore pointer events while keeping visuals unchanged and interactive layers on top.
acceptanceCriteria: Decorative layers render normally but have no impact on clicking/scrolling/hovering interactive UI.
Interactive components remain above decorative layers in stacking order and reliably receive click events across sections.

file_operations.description: Add a small set of global utility rules/classes to standardize decorative-layer behavior (e.g., a reusable class that applies pointer-events: none for purely decorative overlays) and, if needed, a safe z-index convention to keep interactive content above background layers.
Apply the decorative-layer no-pointer-events convention to every full-screen background layer in this component (not just the canvas) to guarantee they never capture clicks/hover/scroll.

Apply the decorative-layer no-pointer-events convention to the hero background visual container/layers (absolute inset elements and spinning images) so only the intended interactive content receives pointer events.

requirements.summary: Add a minimal development-only click/debug aid to quickly confirm click handling works, with no visible/debug logging in production builds.
acceptanceCriteria: In development, it is straightforward to verify click handling without inspecting multiple components manually.
Production build contains no visible debug UI and does not log noisy click-debug output.

file_operations.description: Create a minimal dev-only click verification helper (e.g., a small fixed test button/overlay that reports click success and/or logs a single concise message). Ensure it is designed to not obstruct the UI (small footprint, positioned away from primary controls) and is appropriate for temporary diagnosis.
Render the ClickDebug helper only in development mode (e.g., gated by the build toolâ€™s dev flag) so production builds contain no visible debug UI and no click-debug logging.
